feed.title: Nautical Backup Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for Nautical Backup: v2.10.0
entry.content:
Thank you to @mrjk for creating and submitting a PR for this feature.

Multi-Instance Label Prefix

Sometimes, running multiple insances of nautical-backup can enable extra funcunality: such as unique CRON schedules for different containers, etc.

By default, nautical-backup will only scan containers having labels starting with nautical-backup.*. To be able to run multiple instances of nautical-backup, you may want to customize the label prefix to avoid colision among instances.

Default: nautical-backup

```yaml services: # Multiple instance of nautical nautical-inst1: environment: - LABEL_PREFIX=nautical-backup.inst1 nautical-inst2: environment: - LABEL_PREFIX=nautical-backup.inst2

# Multi targets backuped-inst1: labels: - nautical-backup.inst1.enable=true backuped-inst2: labels: - nautical-backup.inst2.enable=true ```

What Else Changed

  • Update minituff/nautical-backup Docker tag to v2.9.5 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/402
  • Update dependency httpx to v0.28.1 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/403
  • Update dependency mkdocs-material to v9.5.48 by @renovate in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/404
  • add support for multi-instances by @mrjk in https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/pull/398

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Minituff/nautical-backup/compare/v2.9.5...v2.10.0
